Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SyCPA 144 (mucilasyn; chemically synthetic AMPs20; Phe-rich; XXD2, XXL, fatty acid cyclized lipopeptide, lactam, XXJ, UCSB1e)
Sequence Information.Source: bioinformatic predicted bacterial nonribosomal gene cluster,Paenibacillus mucilaginosusKNP414, bacteria-derived, natural derivatives
Sequence Information.Target Organism: active against B. subtilis 168 1A1 (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. faecium Com15 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. aureus USA300 (MIC 8 ug/ml), E-coli DH5alpha (MIC>64 ug/ml), K-pneumoniae ATCC 10031 (MIC>64 ug/ml), A. baumannii ATCC 17978 (MIC 8 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC>64 ug/ml), E-cloacae ATCC 14037 (MIC>64 ug/ml), M-tuberculosis H37RV (MIC>12.5 ug/ml).
Sequence Information.N-terminal Modification: coupled with fatty acid 3-aminotetradecanoic acid; F1, ornithine2 (warning: represented with K) are D-amino acids (XXD2)

Literature.Author: Chu J, Koirala B, Forelli N, Vila-Farres X, Ternei MA, Ali T, Colosimo DA, Brady SF. 2020
Literature.Title: Synthetic-Bioinformatic Natural Product Antibiotics with Diverse Modes of Action.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: the peptide was predicted but made in a different way.
